author: Natalie Andrews and Siobhan Hughes
title: The Short Bench of Contenders to Succeed Ryan
text:
WASHINGTON—House Speaker Paul Ryan’s announcement Wednesday that he would be leaving Congress when his term expires sets up a battle to replace him at the helm of the House Republican conference. The top contenders, one of whom will become House speaker or minority leader depending on the outcome of the midterm elections, are Majority Leader Kevin McCarthy and Majority Whip Steve Scalise. They are now the second- and third-highest ranking House Republicans, respectively.
Kevin McCarthy
The 53-year-old Californian has been...
